title: Kernel dies when trying to import shap latest 2 versions
body:
When trying to import `shap` into my notebook (working either with Jupyter Lab or VS code), my kernel keeps on dying due to `shap` alone (see example screengrab here).

Error message reads: `The kernel for Untitled.ipynb appears to have died. It will restart automatically.`.

This was true for both latest version (0.39) and previous version (0.38.1); also made sure both were installed with `sudo` just to verify it's not due to some issue with installation permissions.

When doing something similar with versions 0.36 and 0.37, there are no such issues.

Find below other libraries used in this project for reference.

Using `pip 21.1.2` and Python 3.9 on a Mac (M1, but running on Rosetta terminal).

Does anyone have any lead to what might be the possible issue ? 

```
xgboost==1.4.2
joblib==1.0.1
boto3==1.17.89
seaborn==0.11.1
matplotlib==3.4.2
shap==0.38.1
pandas==1.2.4
numpy==1.19.5
tqdm==4.61.0
lightgbm==3.2.1
geopandas==0.9.0
requests==2.25.1
eli5==0.11.0
click==8.0.1
interpret==0.2.4
scikit_learn==0.24.2
```
